text: No, that’s just a typical week @CapRadioNews.
author: adlerben

text: Friday afternoon news dump: I’m out for the next week.
author: adlerben

text: .@GavinNewsom will proclaim what his office calls a "statewide emergency on wildfires" this morning in Lake County, which has been devastated by recent wildfires. The executive order will expedite forest management projects intended to protect 200 communities prone to fire risk.
author: adlerben

text: Excellent Q from @JeremyBWhite on how many of the Big City Mayors support withholding gas tax road repair funds from local governments that don’t meet their housing goals. Roughly half, mostly from the biggest cities, raise their hands.
author: adlerben

text: “The #cabudget just changed,” @GavinNewsom says, because of his meeting with the big city mayors today. And, he adds, it isn’t just about more money — it’s also about reprioritizing some existing investments.
author: adlerben

text: .@GavinNewsom meets with the mayors of California’s largest cities to discuss new, additional state aid to combat homelessness. “We need to step up our game,” he says.
author: adlerben

text:
As a refresher, here's the @JerryBrownGov veto message on that 2017 bill:

"First, it may not be constitutional. Second, it sets a 'slippery slope' precedent. Today we require tax returns, but what would be next? ... A certified birth certificate?"

https://www.ca.gov/archive/gov39/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/SB_149_Veto_Message_2017.pdf …
author: adlerben

text: Looks like #caleg Dems are trying again to force @realDonaldTrump to release his tax returns in order to appear on California's 2020 ballot. @ilike_mike's bill was vetoed in 2017 by @JerryBrownGov but has reintroduced it this year—as an urgency measure. http://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billNavClient.xhtml?bill_id=201920200SB27 …
author: adlerben

text:
Business, labor and industry groups donated nearly $8 million to events that celebrated @GavinNewsom's inauguration, known as "behested contributions" that circumvent campaign finance limits, and received special access.

It's entirely legal.

http://www.capradio.org/articles/2019/03/19/these-donors-gave-nearly-8-million-at-gavin-newsoms-request-he-gave-them-access-at-his-inaugural-events/ …
author: adlerben

text: New this AM: These Donors Gave Nearly $8 Million At @GavinNewsom’s Request. He Gave Them Access At His Inaugural Events.
author: adlerben

text: Mea culpa. Tweeting while running last minute birthday party errands with a 2-year-old = sloppy.
author: adlerben
